verses.text: In the five and twentieth year of our captivity, in the beginning of the year, in the tenth \add day\add* of the month, in the fourteenth year after that the city was smitten, in the selfsame day the hand of the \sc Lord\sc* was upon me, and brought me thither.
In the visions of God brought he me into the land of Israel, and set me upon a very high mountain, by which \add was\add* as the frame of a city on the south.

And he brought me thither, and behold, \add there was\add* a man, whose appearance \add was\add* like the appearance of brass, with a line of flax in his hand, and a measuring reed; and he stood in the gate.

And the man said unto me, Son of man, behold with thine eyes, and hear with thine ears, and set thine heart upon all that I shall shew thee; for to the intent that \add I\add* might shew \add them\add* unto thee art thou brought hither: declare all that thou seest to the house of Israel.

And behold a wall on the outside of the house round about, and in the manâ€™s hand a measuring reed of six cubits \add long\add* by the cubit and a hand breadth: so he measured the breadth of the building, one reed; and the height, one reed.

Then came he unto the gate which looketh toward the east, and went up the stairs thereof, and measured the threshold of the gate, \add which was\add* one reed broad; and the other threshold \add of the gate, which was\add* one reed broad.

And \add every\add* little chamber \add was\add* one reed long, and one reed broad; and between the little chambers \add were\add* five cubits; and the threshold of the gate by the porch of the gate within \add was\add* one reed.
He measured also the porch of the gate within, one reed.
Then measured he the porch of the gate, eight cubits; and the posts thereof, two cubits; and the porch of the gate \add was\add* inward.

And the little chambers of the gate eastward \add were\add* three on this side, and three on that side; they three \add were\add* of one measure: and the posts had one measure on this side and on that side.
And he measured the breadth of the entry of the gate, ten cubits; \add and\add* the length of the gate, thirteen cubits.

The space also before the little chambers \add was\add* one cubit \add on this side\add*, and the space \add was\add* one cubit on that side: and the little chambers \add were\add* six cubits on this side, and six cubits on that side.
He measured then the gate from the roof of \add one\add* little chamber to the roof of another: the breadth \add was\add* five and twenty cubits, door against door.
He made also posts \add of\add* threescore cubits, even unto the post of the court round about the gate.
And from the face of the gate of the entrance unto the face of the porch of the inner gate \add were\add* fifty cubits.

And \add there were\add* narrow windows to the little chambers, and to their posts within the gate round about, and likewise to the arches: and windows \add were\add* round about inward: and upon \add each\add* post \add were\add* palm trees.
Then brought he me into the outward court, and lo, \add there were\add* chambers, and a pavement made for the court round about: thirty chambers \add were\add* upon the pavement.
And the pavement by the side of the gates over against the length of the gates \add was\add* the lower pavement.
Then he measured the breadth from the forefront of the lower gate unto the forefront of the inner court without, an hundred cubits east\add ward\add* and north\add ward\add*.
And the gate of the outward court that looked toward the north, he measured the length thereof, and the breadth thereof.

And the little chambers thereof \add were\add* three on this side and three on that side; and the posts thereof and the arches thereof were after the measure of the first gate: the length thereof \add was\add* fifty cubits, and the breadth five and twenty cubits.

And their windows, and their arches, and their palm trees, \add were\add* after the measure of the gate that looketh towards the east; and they went up unto it by seven steps; and the arches thereof \add were\add* before them.
And the gate of the inner court \add was\add* over against the gate toward the north, and toward the east; and he measured from gate to gate an hundred cubits.
After that he brought me toward the south, and behold a gate toward the south: and he measured the posts thereof and the arches thereof according to these measures.
And \add there were\add* windows in it and in the arches thereof round about, like those windows: the length \add was\add* fifty cubits, and the breadth five and twenty cubits.
And \add there were\add* seven steps to go up to it, and the arches thereof \add were\add* before them: and it had palm trees, one on this side, and another on that side, upon the posts thereof.
And \add there was\add* a gate in the inner court toward the south: and he measured from gate to gate toward the south an hundred cubits.
And he brought me to the inner court by the south gate: and he measured the south gate according to these measures;

and the little chambers thereof, and the posts thereof, and the arches thereof, according to these measures: and \add there were\add* windows in it and in the arches thereof round about: \add it was\add* fifty cubits long, and five and twenty cubits broad.
And the arches round about \add were\add* five and twenty cubits long, and five cubits broad.
And the arches thereof \add were\add* toward the utter court; and palm trees \add were\add* upon the posts thereof: and the going up to it \add had\add* eight steps.
And he brought me into the inner court toward the east: and he measured the gate according to these measures.

And the little chambers thereof, and the posts thereof, and the arches thereof, \add were\add* according to these measures: and \add there were\add* windows therein and in the arches thereof round about: \add it was\add* fifty cubits long, and five and twenty cubits broad.
And the arches thereof \add were\add* toward the outward court; and palm trees \add were\add* upon the posts thereof, on this side, and on that side: and the going up to it \add had\add* eight steps.
And he brought me to the north gate, and measured \add it\add* according to these measures;
the little chambers thereof, the posts thereof, and the arches thereof, and the windows to it round about: the length \add was\add* fifty cubits, and the breadth five and twenty cubits.
And the posts thereof \add were\add* toward the utter court; and palm trees \add were\add* upon the posts thereof, on this side, and on that side: and the going up to it \add had\add* eight steps.
And the chambers and the entries thereof \add were\add* by the posts of the gates, where they washed the burnt offering.
And in the porch of the gate \add were\add* two tables on this side, and two tables on that side, to slay thereon the burnt offering and the sin offering and the trespass offering.
And at the side without, as one goeth up to the entry of the north gate, \add were\add* two tables; and on the other side, which \add was\add* at the porch of the gate, \add were\add* two tables.
Four tables \add were\add* on this side, and four tables on that side, by the side of the gate; eight tables, whereupon they slew \add their sacrifices\add*.

And the four tables \add were\add* of hewn stone for the burnt offering, of a cubit and a half long, and a cubit and a half broad, and one cubit high: whereupon also they laid the instruments wherewith they slew the burnt offering and the sacrifice.
And within \add were\add* hooks, a hand broad, fastened round about: and upon the tables \add was\add* the flesh of the offering.

And without the inner gate \add were\add* the chambers of the singers in the inner court, which \add was\add* at the side of the north gate; and their prospect \add was\add* toward the south: one at the side of the east gate \add having\add* the prospect toward the north.
And he said unto me, This chamber, whose prospect \add is\add* toward the south, \add is\add* for the priests, the keepers of the charge of the house.

And the chamber whose prospect \add is\add* toward the north \add is\add* for the priests, the keepers of the charge of the altar: these \add are\add* the sons of Zadok among the sons of Levi, which come near to the \sc Lord\sc* to minister unto him.
So he measured the court, an hundred cubits long, and an hundred cubits broad, foursquare; and the altar \add that was\add* before the house.

And he brought me to the porch of the house, and measured \add each\add* post of the porch, five cubits on this side, and five cubits on that side: and the breadth of the gate \add was\add* three cubits on this side, and three cubits on that side.

The length of the porch \add was\add* twenty cubits, and the breadth eleven cubits; and \add he brought me\add* by the steps whereby they went up to it: and \add there were\add* pillars by the posts, one on this side, and another on that side.
